### matchAndEmitInstruction() {#ab72e0fac1068472843d159e653895c92}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool HexagonAsmParser::matchAndEmitInstruction (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> IDLoc, unsigned &amp; Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61e27c75c3334cffa54c44c02077da1e">OperandVector</a> &amp; Operands, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcstreamer">MCStreamer</a> &amp; Out, uint64&#95;t &amp; ErrorInfo, bool MatchingInlineAsm)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Recognize a series of operands of a parsed instruction as an actual MCInst and emit it to the specified MCStreamer.

This returns false on success and returns true on failure to match.

On failure, the target parser is responsible for emitting a diagnostic explaining the match failure.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/lib/target/hexagon/asmparser/hexagonasmparser-cpp/#l00136">136</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/lib/target/hexagon/asmparser/hexagonasmparser-cpp">HexagonAsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ParseDirectiveFalign() {#af75eb81a6f88b1489d60d728815be1ae}

<MemberDefinition

tryParseRegister - parse one register if possible

Check whether a register specification can be parsed at the current location, without failing the entire parse if it can&#39;t. Must not consume tokens if the parse fails.

### validateTargetOperandClass() {#a439ce6fbb3c8ea2ee3aa981dfd879f8f}

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Allow a target to add special case operand matching for things that tblgen doesn&#39;t/can&#39;t handle effectively.

For example, literal immediates on ARM. TableGen expects a token operand, but the parser will recognize them as immediates.

Parse an instruction.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/lib/target/hexagon/asmparser/hexagonasmparser-cpp/#l00177">177</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/lib/target/hexagon/asmparser/hexagonasmparser-cpp">HexagonAsmParser.cpp</a>.

### parseInstruction {#ae7f146d81c6cddcff295972985bfcc86}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;HexagonAsmParser.cpp&#125;::HexagonAsmParser::parseInstruction (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/parseinstructioninfo">ParseInstructionInfo</a> &amp; Info, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> NameLoc, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61e27c75c3334cffa54c44c02077da1e">OperandVector</a> &amp; Operands)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Parse one assembly instruction.

The parser is positioned following the instruction name. The target specific instruction parser should parse the entire instruction and construct the appropriate MCInst, or emit an error. On success, the entire line should be parsed up to and including the end-of-statement token. On failure, the parser is not required to read to the end of the line. 
<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Name">- The instruction name.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="NameLoc">- The source location of the name.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Operands">&#91;out&#93; - The list of parsed operands, this returns ownership of them to the caller.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
True on failure.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/lib/target/hexagon/asmparser/hexagonasmparser-cpp/#l00182">182</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/lib/target/hexagon/asmparser/hexagonasmparser-cpp">HexagonAsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
